website_summaries.verdict: The best budget electric metal shear capable of handling most soft and thin metals.
pros: Large metal cutters can be rotated 360 degrees to position the shear correctly
Variable-speed trigger controls the speed with pressure
cons: It can be difficult to control curved cuts with the swiveling head, depending on the cutting angle

customer_reviews.title: Works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Works better than expected. I cut at most 20ga stainless steel, mostly cut 22ga galvanized steel sheets. For straight lines, this thing is incredible. Pretty much pulls itself down the sheet, you just have to keep it lined up which isn't difficult. I wouldn't recommend getting this to cut anything other than straight lines. A little bit of ugly curves isn't a big deal, but it's not going to cut perfect circles. It also removes about 1/4" strip of metal as it cuts, so don't plan on turning a 4x10 into 2 exact 4x5's.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy for the correct guage.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, it is a solid buy. Pretty well-made. I am a metal worker of 25 years and mostly use air tools, but purchased this for when i do not have a compressor on-site. My critical comment would be that the jaws do not open very wide so it prevents the trial of thicker materials ( maybe that's the intention) but what it also does is shorten the cutting bite length significantly. Works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Monkle124

customer_reviews.title: Not good on curves.
customer_reviews.text: Great for cutting in a straight line. If you are planning to cut corrugated metal roofing, it won't do a good job if you are trying to cut curves. It will trim panels like nobody's business, but for curves you are much better off using hand snips.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: simply amazing! Next
customer_reviews.text: So, first, Kudos to Amazon and 1 day shipping, simply amazing! Next, this tool is great! It sliced through the Home Depot galvanized roofing material like butter. Granted, this is pretty thin stuff, but I can't imagine it would slow down much on material thats 2 or 3 times thicker. It took a bit to get it started, but once the entire cutting head is on the material it goes very quickly. As others have said, this is for straight lines, it will NOT turn. I don't know how long the tool will last, but I imagine it will last a lifetime for how often I need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: you have to follow the contours of the metal and then it cuts fine. If you don't have the ability to that
customer_reviews.text: Prior to using this tool, I cut by hand with tin snips. This machine is very fast and cuts clean. On the corrogated tin, you have to follow the contours of the metal and then it cuts fine. If you don't have the ability to that, then it's difficult to do so with tool. This tool is a must have if you do any metal work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Vaca

customer_reviews.title: Cuts but sometime it needs a push.
customer_reviews.text: Cutting aluminum sheets with it. It will cut but sometimes you have to force it along to start it feeding again.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Hartung

customer_reviews.title: Another Generic China Clone
customer_reviews.text: There must be one factory in China cranking these out for 100 different ‘brand’ name labels. My Eastwood cutter ( same tool) burned up cutting 20 gauge sheet. I replaced it with this one. It’s just as awkward and heavy as all the other Harbor Freight clones. Hope it lasts longer bThe only difference seems to be what color of plastic they use for the body of each so-called brand. * 1 star for maneuverability because these are really straight line cutters no matter what they claim.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Not well made.
customer_reviews.text: The moveable jaw on the one I got was a real loose and sloppy fit. As a result it did not cut cleanly and pulled the edge of cut aluminum and left a rounded edge.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, great, great!
customer_reviews.text: Great shears. I have arthritis in my hands and last month I used tin sips to cut a small piece of tin, it took almost an hour and a lot of pain (also some finger cuts.) I bought these electric shears and less than 5 minutes with no cut fingers to cut 5 pieces of roofing tin. Minor pain because shears are well make and heavy, but nothing like the manual type. Cuts very fast and straight. Best shears I have ever had. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ray B. Davis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through corrugated sheet metal without too much difficulty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to complete a corrugated sheet metal knee wall in my yard. It took a little while to get used to how to most efficiently cut across the sheet metal but eventually, i got the "hang of it." The sheets i was cutting where about 28" across and i think that's probably the upper limit of what this shear can do because it tends to get a bit bogged down and "stuck" in the middle of the sheet. Overall, i'm happy with its performance and price point and would recommend it for the home diy-er.
customer_reviews.author: oriah

customer_reviews.title: I could't get the head to swivel easily, but Im sure I could if I really ...
customer_reviews.text: This tool works incredibly well for the price point. I spent about 4 hours cutting 14 gauge black iron with it on the first use and it performed flawlessly. I could't get the head to swivel easily, but Im sure I could if I really needed that functionality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Actually an amazing product considering the price. I have probably cut 50 or so feet of 18ga. Aluminum strips and while it doesn't always glide right along all the time (gets stuck occasionally), it usually cuts well and leaves a decent edge. With practice i am cutting circles also and i think it is capable of quite a bit heavier cutting abilities also. Beats the heck out of tin snips! Seems very well made.
customer_reviews.author: kate

customer_reviews.title: Time and Hand Saver!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool! I am so glad I bought it. I was trying to cut sheet metal with a pair of manual sheers and it killed my hand and took forever! This tool saved my hands and saved a lot of time! I was shocked at how easy they are to use. I am not super skilled with power tools and lack a lot of confidence using them, so I was naturally intimidated, but it cut through the metal like butter. It was actually fun! If you are trying to cut sheet metal, do not bother using a manual tool, get yourself this tool. I am so glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: DLightfull

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: With this one you get what you pay for. It is very unbalanced, which makes it very difficult to use. It cuts slow or fast with no in between. Cutting was hit or miss.
customer_reviews.author: WJHickman

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: Broke on the first use. Bolts ripped right out of the crappy aluminum. Disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Tim Mannering

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many tools from amazon and I have always been satisfied with every purchase until this tool. It was not able to maneuver through metal easily. It also completely died after the second job. Take my advice and purchase another brand.
customer_reviews.author: todd bailey

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as the dewalt shear I use at work and for a fraction of the price. In large working areas it works wonderfully, quicker and with less mess then a grinder with a cut wheel. Works best in a straight line although you can muscle it around if need be to cut sweeping corners. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone who needs to cut sheet metal with any detail though, could be possible but there are better tools for the job. All and all certainly can't beat if for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Aug 2018. Used for a few metal roof jobs along with odd jobs. I does take a little practice to learn how to cut perfect straight lines. Also, to learn the best angles to cut circles etc. Suggest practicing on scrape or edges that will not show. After you get the hang of it. Bets hands shears a million times over. Powerful jaws cut right through a variety of sheet metal gages. Tip. If you feel like not cutting smoothly. A few drops of machine oil in the jaws does the trick. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Crawford

customer_reviews.title: An absolute beast of a tool
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut down a sheet of 2mm mild steel to better fit the airflow in the laser-cutter. I approached this job with some trepidation, because it's only supposed to handle 18-gauge steel, not 14-gauge (~2mm). It went through the sheet of steel like a hot knife through butter - it was effortless. Considering how little this cost, it's an absolute steel. Pun intended.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Good in flat metal
customer_reviews.text: I has a bunch of metal roofing to cut. Shears work great on the horizontal cuts..not so good on the vertical ones. Worked pretty quickly horizontally but I sure struggled with the vertical. In the end, I used the shears only on the horizontal lines and used aviation snips on the vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts 20 gauge stainless steel with ease!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical when it said that it would cut up to 20 gauge of stainless steel. I thought it would get bogged down. I was pleasantly surprised. I cut about 15' of 20 gauge stainless steel with no problem at all. I also used it for cutting .100" thick diamond plate aluminum. That's almost 10 gauge! I cut the diamond plate from the back side which makes it easier...but it did struggle every so often as it would get hung up on the raised tread pattern.... I'm happy with that since they never claimed it would cut that thick to begin with. Overall great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: DHarlett

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, the alignment of the tines were off right out of the box. Decent for projects that don't require speed or accuracy. Wouldn't recommend for any kind of professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Metal Cutting Tool
customer_reviews.text: Unit works great to cut straight lines. Not so good when making turns or outlet cut outs in stainless steel metal. You just have to allow for the 1/4" gap the cutting blades make when making a cut. Id purchase this product again. Just remember the limitations for its use. I cut 18G stainless and it melted right thru it. Metal was embossed and it slowed the cutting line a little but still cut a good line.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Worked as expected
customer_reviews.text: It worked faster than I thought it would. I had to cut up an old appliance to get it out the door and it chopped it right up. I was worried if it could cut the thick sheet metal but it did. It was not able to cut through the double layer of sheet metal at the splices or welds, but other than that, it zipped right through. Quiet, fast and minimal dust.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use after I found the key to getting this through the metal
customer_reviews.text: It took me a bit of time, plus trial and error to figure out that I needed to move this about as fast as I could possibly shove the cutter through the corrugated tin roofing, which negatively affected my accuracy and control.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hartig

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a lot of shears and read a lot of reviews. I ended up buying this inexpensive model with very good reviews. It lives up to its reviews. I'm using it on steel siding and it works great. Great tool, great value.
customer_reviews.author: Katica

customer_reviews.title: Quite Surprised
customer_reviews.text: The power and ease of cutting with this tool was surprising at the least. I have cut Stainless Steel, metal roofing, and 18 gauge sheet metal. cut all of it with ease. Metal roofing is a challenge with it, as it will not cut up the peaks, I turned it over and came from back side to make my cuts on them
customer_reviews.author: Terry Teague

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on tin metal that needed to be cut
customer_reviews.text: This product worked really well for cutting tin metal to put up trim on house. Also works well for cutting tin to finish a carport to use for our boats. Great product and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schuette

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I was going to be cutting a lot of sheet metal for my roof replacement. It looks like I received a refurbished one as there were scratches. However, I used it today for more than 3 hours and it works perfectly. I couldn't be more pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Pauleen D Orme

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting formica.
customer_reviews.text: I saw this used on YouTube to cut formica. Purchased it myself. Talk about making the job a tons easier. Went through it like butter. I recommend this to anyone needing to cut formica.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: The easy Solution!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this tool was such a time saver. We were using a jigsaw to make all the cuts on the sheet metal for the walls of our project and it was time consuming and did not leave a clean cut. The metal shear was quick and efficient and left a nice smooth cut. The shears plug in and operated perfectly with no issues. A very great buy to save time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L Scholl

customer_reviews.title: fast cutting, but a heavy on your wrist.
customer_reviews.text: OK. It cuts well and once you get used to it, you can keep it on the line (thin sheet metal) but it is heavy and puts a strain on my wrist, and does not make curved cuts very well at all. really only good for making straight sweeping nibbles. But I will make much use of it. Powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Metal Siding Cutting
customer_reviews.text: Great for using with metal siding. I was tossing between using a special saw blade or these shears when faced with a big barn siding job; I opted for the latter. It turned out to be an indispensable tool that sped up the job considerably. I’d never used one before and it took a few minutes to figure out how to maneuver it. I think you’ll like it.
customer_reviews.author: Paulusatp

customer_reviews.title: These shears will not cut through ribs in metal roofing.
customer_reviews.text: These shears will cut through flat metal fine, but if you need to cut through ribs or anything not flat, forget it. I had to purchase a metal cutting saw blade for my skill saw to cut through ribs. I would not have purchased these if I knew this before.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything it's supposed to be. 16g is no problem, so it's strong.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks
customer_reviews.text: Bite off more than you can chew and chew it comes to mind with this product. I might void my warranty, but I was able to cut some 16 gauge metal. :O
customer_reviews.author: Peer

customer_reviews.title: Decent value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Used it for a little while and it worked okay. Not great....just okay. I broke the shear on it but that was probably my fault by trying to cut something that was a wee bit too thick for this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Pajama6

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend this to anyone. Binds up easily on 22 gauge tin. Difficult to make clean cuts. Regret buying this cheap tool.
customer_reviews.author: JFG

customer_reviews.title: It worked great, It was a little bit hard going over ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut corrugated metal from our old boat house that we tore down. It worked great, It was a little bit hard going over the bumps, but if you put a little muscle in it, it worked fine!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Metal shear
customer_reviews.text: This tool works great on lightweight metal sheet metal. Does not work on heavy sheets but cuts up to 1/16 just fine.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly great. Given the reviews I though it wouldn't be able to turn corners at all. It's been just as nimble as tin snips, so I call that "turning corners well"! We are cutting 20 gauge structural steel c-channel with it and it can get around the whole shape of the formed metal.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Other reviews have pretty much nailed it.
customer_reviews.text: It's helpful and good for the price. Sturdier than expected, too. Forget about doing any serious curves. That isn't happening.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: It works!  It’s noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Great and reliable for a power tool. It does what it’s supposed to do. It is noisy, however. As if the racket of sheet metal wasn’t enough already.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Props

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to cut up an above ground pool. The tool performed admirably. Quiet and powerful, it took care of the metal I needed to cut.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works like expected
customer_reviews.text: Typical of most scissor jaw cutters, requires a fair amount of force (pushing) to keep metal in the jaws when they close. Time will tell if the cutters and motor hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: SMOOTH Metal cutter
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for metal work. Saved more than 6 hours clean up if I continued with a grinding wheel. Quick. Clean. Smooth edges
customer_reviews.author: Stewbie

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: used this to carve out some automotive patch panels. did get stuck a few times, but worked well overall
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New toy for husband
customer_reviews.text: He wanted to start cutting metal art. He has just sampled it so far, and says it cuts like butter! Looking forward to seeing his "art" from this new toy.
customer_reviews.author: GEM

customer_reviews.title: Package damaged
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband and it came in a torn damaged box ☹️
customer_reviews.author: MiMi B

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool
customer_reviews.text: This thing cuts like a warm knife through butter. It does best in flat straight cuts. I used hand tools for curves and ridges.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Witkowski

customer_reviews.title: Work great modified the Jaws to cut concrete board
customer_reviews.text: I give it five stars but for some reason it won't let me give it five stars when I push on it
customer_reviews.author: Robin Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for thinner sheet metal
customer_reviews.text: Does not care for 18ga mild steel. Straight line only and difficult at best.
customer_reviews.author: Brad P.

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty tool I bought this to replace an air ...
customer_reviews.text: heavy duty tool I bought this to replace an air powered tool I used it to complete the trimming of sheet metal roof much faster than air powered tool
customer_reviews.author: William E. Weiser

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Works great makes cutting metal or rigid plastic very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.W. 60

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It struggles a little more on curves than name brand versions of this that I've used, but curves aren't the main strength of these kind of cutters anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money. Durable tool.
customer_reviews.text: My husband and dad both raced about how easily the could cut with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Elsayed

customer_reviews.title: Not for corrugated metal
customer_reviews.text: Jaws do not open very far was very hard to cut corrugated metal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really slick!
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy. With my arthritic hands I wasn't able to use it safely.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia S.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a one time project to enclose my pole barn. These snipes have worked well without investing in a more expensive product. Have sheared for door, windows and gables.
customer_reviews.author: repittman

customer_reviews.title: Electric shears
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once so far and it did the job
customer_reviews.author: stuart automotive inc

customer_reviews.title: cuts 16 ga steel very easily
customer_reviews.text: 16 gauge steel is beyond the capability of the hand shears I have but this goes through it with no effort. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This shear cuts the sheet metal like butter. It is easy on the hands and quick.
customer_reviews.author: Phydo11

customer_reviews.title: Stick with metal snips before you buy this for roofing
customer_reviews.text: Not for cutting corrugated steel metal roofing. It can't make the ribs movement. Well it can with alot of work but was 10 times easier using snips.
customer_reviews.author: fox

customer_reviews.title: Easily cuts stove pipe sheet metal
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, 4 amp motor, variable speed cuts through sheet steel and aluminum. Limited to14 Gauge aluminum, 20 gauge stainless steel, or 18 gauge Steel.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyD

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good for money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mostly to take the blades off and use on a different, better quality, set. But they actually work really well.
customer_reviews.author: Travis L.

customer_reviews.title: Not too sure...
customer_reviews.text: Used on thin aluminum coil stock. Cuts a waisted strip of about 3/16". In this case, probably better than decent hand shears, but not buy much. I probably wouldn't buy again, but possible my expectations were too high.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cuts metal roofing like a dream
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a must have. I've only used it for metal roofing so far but it cuts through it like butter. Beautiful!
customer_reviews.author: Lolani

customer_reviews.title: Proper assembly would make it work better
customer_reviews.text: Good product except it was shipped assembled wrong. The blade was installed upside down when i recieved it. It was pretty easy to take apart and fix. Worked good after fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Buckingham

customer_reviews.title: Great Gadget! cuts single thick steel panels beautifully and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great Gadget! cuts single thick steel panels beautifully and easily. It would be perfect if it went around corners a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Holley

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: Ver good Value for the price the double jaw design makes the cutting easier
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Vvery import part of all my building tools.
customer_reviews.text: I love this cutter. I am a woman who loves to make things. This cutter cuts any metal I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy very good value
customer_reviews.text: Heavier duty than I thought for the price. Cuts metal like going through soft butter. Also nice clean cuts
customer_reviews.author: brian j gonyea

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and clean straight cuts
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fast straight and clean cuts. Don't expect to be able to cut sharp corners or narrow curves though. I paid under $60 for this quality tool - love it, thanks
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nielson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I bought it sooner!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and cuts amazingly, packaged nicely and came quickly.
customer_reviews.author: lewis

customer_reviews.title: very easy to
customer_reviews.text: this thing is a work horse. very easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Mike O.

customer_reviews.title: Good shears for the money
customer_reviews.text: The shears did a great job on straight cuts on the flat metal but were difficult to use on the corrugated surface of the metal siding. All and all, they did a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good cutter, a little cumbersome to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Very good cutter, a little cumbersome to maneuver, and it is difficult to make cross cuts on corrugated roof panels.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, I was able to cut lightweight to heavy metal. The only thing I failed to do, is follow the cutting direction, I got carried away.
customer_reviews.author: sammy holaso

customer_reviews.title: cuts great
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shears. Everything they said it was. They are sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: eaglebeak

customer_reviews.title: was a great fit for my need
customer_reviews.text: I just needed to open some duct work for small job. This tool was inexpensive, and it worked well for what I had to do. I'm might not use the tool again. The fact that I could get the GES40 quickly, and for less then most other tools on the market ,was a great fit for my need.
customer_reviews.author: kyle gill

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping was awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I have been able to do the cutting that I wanted fast and easy, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly underpowered for metal roofing.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. I would buy a more powerful one if I had to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Carson

customer_reviews.title: 063 aluminum like a hot knife through butter
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through .063 aluminum like a hot knife through butter.
customer_reviews.author: MikeBoyle

customer_reviews.title: great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: this beats the hell out of a cutoff wheel, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It will cut!
customer_reviews.text: It will cut! IT's an economy tool, I bought it for a small job, and it rips through light gauge sheet metal.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S

customer_reviews.title: ... as a replacement pairs for when the cutter gets dull down the road
customer_reviews.text: bought as a replacement pairs for when the cutter gets dull down the road. The tool these parts work on does a good job too.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: how cool is this
customer_reviews.text: Wow, how cool is this, it cuts steel like butter, leaving behind a clean edge.
customer_reviews.author: Mossback

customer_reviews.title: Work good but is heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Work good , its not expensive ..has good price, the only thing is too heavy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A “shear” delight!
customer_reviews.text: These shears cut right through heavy gauge roofing metal with ease. I had been unable to cut the same metal with tin snips at all.
customer_reviews.author: Popbailey

customer_reviews.title: Only used once for a specific job I needed it ...
customer_reviews.text: Only used once for a specific job I needed it for but its been added to my tool inventory. I know nothing about these but it performed as described
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like as beast
customer_reviews.text: Using this in shop class to cut down sheet metal.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lanier

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: DIdnt work as expected. Would not cut sheet metal effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Omgitworks

customer_reviews.title: works great but
customer_reviews.text: the main head was supposed to swivel and mine wouldnt, seller took it back no problem
customer_reviews.author: john mccann

customer_reviews.title: Rrrrrrrr
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I am dislike with it. And I use it for sheet metal cutting up to 20 gauge it is a very helpful tool. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Veliz

customer_reviews.title: this worked good, I missed the fine print of up to ...
customer_reviews.text: this worked good , I missed the fine print of up to 14 gauge , thinking steel use . I used it to take down my above ground pool walls and it worked great . It had folded over edges and cut right thru . I cut the metal to smaller manageable pieces for the trash recycler .
customer_reviews.author: claw

customer_reviews.title: Hand saver.
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to work I would recommend this .. I use it all the time
customer_reviews.author: Melissa P.

customer_reviews.title: does not cut over the "humps " in metal roofing without brute force!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: does not cut over the "humps " in metal roofing without brute force!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Should have purchased one of these years ago. Beets tin snips hands down. Does not work well on tall ribbed metal roofing cross cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Eian Darling

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased and heavy duty for product not used everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Durability and price
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to use and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: sofera la foucade

product_meta.title: Genesis GES40 4.0 Amp Corded Swivel Head Variable Speed Electric Power Metal Shear
product_meta.description:
Style:Power Shear

The Genesis GES40 swivel head electric metal sheer tool cuts through various metals with ease with a 4.0 amp motor.

- 4.0 Amp Motor
-360° Swivel Head for cutting curves in sheet metal
-Quickly cuts metal roofing, flashing, and other sheet metal up to 14 gauge
-Three blades work to reduce metal deformation
-Cut 14 Gauge aluminum, 20 gauge stainless steel, or 18 gauge Steel

Genesis' two year warranty means you buy with confidence. Cord Length- 72 inches.
feature_bullets: Quickly cuts metal roofing, flashing, and other sheet metal up to 14 gauge | Compare the Genesis metal shear to other drill attachment Shears that can only cut 20 gauge Sheet metal!
360° swiveling head for cutting control and convenience |cut circles and curves with the Genesis electric metal shear
Variable speed (0-2500) SPM for versatility in cutting a variety of materials | cuts through sheet metal up to 14 gauge in thickness!
Three blade cutting system reduces metal deformation | experience smooth cuts EVERYTIME!

specifications.Included Components: One metal shear tool, Hex-key for blade replacement
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars399 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
